messages.content: This file contains the questions and answers derived from the text about the Gaza War.
When did Israel's latest assault on the Gaza Strip begin?
Israel's latest assault on the Gaza Strip began on October 7, following Hamas's surprise attack.
How many people have been killed by the Israeli military since the start of their latest assault on Gaza?
The Israeli military has killed more than 10,500 people, at least 4,300 of whom are children.
How many targets has Israel struck in Gaza from October 7 to November 1?
Israel has struck at least 12,000 targets across the besieged Palestinian territory.
How much explosives has Israel dropped on the Gaza Strip since October 7?
Israel has dropped more than 25,000 tonnes of explosives on the Gaza Strip since October 7.
What types of facilities have been damaged or destroyed by the Israeli attacks in Gaza?
Many hospitals, schools, places of worship, homes, communication systems, and water treatment plants have been damaged or destroyed by Israeli land, sea, and air attacks.
How many residential units in Gaza have been damaged?
Half of Gaza’s homes, amounting to about 222,000 residential units, have been damaged, with more than 40,000 completely destroyed.
What has been said about Israel's use of 'smart bombs' in Gaza?

Elijah Magnier, a military analyst, said that Israel's use of 'smart bombs' in Gaza is part of a broader military strategy aimed at targeting militant infrastructure, with no attempt to limit civilian casualties and infrastructure damage.
How many refugees live in Gaza?
Gaza is home to some 1.7 million refugees who were ethnically cleansed from areas that now form part of Israel.
Which refugee camp in the northern Gaza Strip has been hit multiple times by the Israeli military?
The Jabalia camp in the north of Gaza, one of the largest camps with some 116,000 registered refugees, has been repeatedly hit by the Israeli military.
Who was the Hamas commander killed in the attacks on Jabalia on November 1?
The Hamas commander killed in the attacks on Jabalia on November 1 was Ibrahim Biari, who was believed to have played a pivotal role in the planning and execution of the October 7 attacks on Israel.
